title: How much you need to earn to be able to work a four-day week
text:
Taking a long weekend once in a while feels like a real luxury, but is it possible to make that once in a blue moon occurrence a more permanent reality?

Balancing work and home life is something that has been pushed into the public eye recently after Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell announced a controversial plan for Britons to work a four-day week.

His proposal is unlikely to happen for the masses anytime soon, but some companies allow employees to work fewer days. Is it actually viable for most people?

Darren Cooke at RedCircle Financial Planning, said a growing number of people are eschewing 20pc of their salary by working one less day per week "to fit work around life rather than the other...
